DOC.brief_summary: Introduction: Different groups already showed in retrospective subgroup analyses, that there is an increased risk for cardiovascular events in patients on a simultaneous ASA/NSAID treatment. Methods: Light-Transmission aggregometry Hypothesis: Simultaneous administration of different NSAIDs and ASA impair the platelet inhibiting effect of ASA.
DOC.brief_title: NSAIDs in Coronary Artery Disease Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients on a simultaneous ASA, NSAID treatment > 18 years unconsciousness, not able to consent reanimation, cardiac shock
